body:
GZip filter + grpc_json_transcoder doesn't work on some client

*Description*:
We have noticed that some clients are reporting invalid gzip streams for requests done through gzip+grpc_json_transcoder filters. Other requests simply going through the gzip filter do not have this issue.

For example, given the following config:

```
admin:
  access_log_path: /tmp/admin_access.log
  address: { socket_address: { address: 0.0.0.0, port_value: 8900 } }

static_resources:
  listeners:
  - name: main_listener
    address: { socket_address: { address: 0.0.0.0, port_value: 8000 } }
    filter_chains:
    - filters:
      - name: envoy.http_connection_manager
        config:
          stat_prefix: ingress_http
          codec_type: auto
          use_remote_address: true
          route_config:
            name: local_route
            virtual_hosts:
            - name: backend
              domains: ["*"]
              routes:
              - match: { prefix: "/plain" }
                route: { cluster: plain_hello }
              - match: { prefix: "/" }
                route: { cluster: grpc_hello }
          http_filters:
          - name: envoy.gzip
          - name: envoy.grpc_json_transcoder
            config:
              proto_descriptor: /app/descriptors.pb
              services: ["HelloService.HelloService"]
          - name: envoy.router
    perConnectionBufferLimitBytes: 16384000

  clusters:
    - name: grpc_hello
      connect_timeout: 1.0s
      type: logical_dns
      lb_policy: round_robin
      http2_protocol_options: {}
      hosts:
      - socket_address: { address: 127.0.0.1, port_value: 30000 }
    - name: plain_hello
      connect_timeout: 1.0s
      type: logical_dns
      lb_policy: round_robin
      hosts:
      - socket_address: { address: 127.0.0.1, port_value: 5000 }
```

A request to the `plain_hello` endpoint with gzip compression works fine:
```
$ curl -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip" -v http://127.0.0.1:8000/plain/hello | gunzip
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 8000 (#0)
> GET /plain/hello HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:8000
> User-Agent: curl/7.47.0
> Accept: */*
> Accept-Encoding: gzip
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< content-type: text/html; charset=utf-8
< server: envoy
< date: Fri, 10 May 2019 16:54:16 GMT
< x-envoy-upstream-service-time: 1
< vary: Accept-Encoding
< content-encoding: gzip
< transfer-encoding: chunked
< 
{ [74 bytes data]
100    58    0    58    0     0  11225      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 14500
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
plain hello world! 012345678901234567890123456789
```

While a request to the `grpc_hello` endpoint with gzip compression produces an error:
```
$ curl -H "Accept-Encoding: gzip" -v http://127.0.0.1:8000/grpc/hello | gunzip
*   Trying 127.0.0.1...
  % Total    % Received % Xferd  Average Speed   Time    Time     Time  Current
                                 Dload  Upload   Total   Spent    Left  Speed
  0     0    0     0    0     0      0      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:--     0* Connected to 127.0.0.1 (127.0.0.1) port 8000 (#0)
> GET /grpc/hello HTTP/1.1
> Host: 127.0.0.1:8000
> User-Agent: curl/7.47.0
> Accept: */*
> Accept-Encoding: gzip
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< content-type: application/json
< grpc-accept-encoding: identity,deflate,gzip
< accept-encoding: identity,gzip
< x-envoy-upstream-service-time: 0
< grpc-status: 0
< grpc-message: 
< vary: Accept-Encoding
< content-encoding: gzip
< date: Fri, 10 May 2019 16:55:58 GMT
< server: envoy
< transfer-encoding: chunked
< 
{ [68 bytes data]
100    57    0    57    0     0  37279      0 --:--:-- --:--:-- --:--:-- 57000
* Connection #0 to host 127.0.0.1 left intact
{"text":"gRPC hello world! 012345678901234567890123456789"}
gzip: stdin: unexpected end of file
```

Note that the payload is ok, it is just the gzip output that appears to be missing some trailing bytes. 

This looks similar to what was reported in #2909 and fixed in #3025 .  This occurs on all Envoy versions I have tested (v1.7.0, v1.8.0, v1.10.0), (with the particularity that I need to change where the gzip filter is inserted in older Envoy configs).
